column5: 36 days to Blackbirch Lake with Northern Outposts out of Armstrong.
28 days 17 hours 52 minutes 38 seconds till Dogtooth
6 more nights at home.
Five nights for me.
down to 23 days
Leaving tomorrow...
I believe 122ish for us until Friday May 30. LOTW for us. Is the area getting much snow this year?
128 days, 15 hours, 30 min and 52 secs till we leave. Can't wait, and don't care what fuel prices may be. I am going anyway.
Wife & I are going last week of Aug. Both she and I are already looking forward to that week. we would go earlier as well, but have a son getting married in July.
29 days to my first trip that I know the actual date of ;) This one... in the states... (WA/OR) Columbia River .
Bringing it back: 116 days to go. Be here before you know it (better be anyway)
109 days to Cedar Lake Lodge, Perrault Falls,Ontarie..cant wait

Down to 96. Bought a 6'er of Molson this past weekend. Will start the menu planning in about two weeks, just to keep the motivation in this ever brutal winter. After that, start cleaning reels and organizing tackle. Boat after that. Hopefully by that time, it will be warm enough to do it outside. 96 days.
Darn, it miscounted. 62 days to go. I can almost smell the spruce
58 days, shouldn't even be going with gas prices and economy but what the heck. I'm goin every chance I get till I can't afford it. Thats why we work.
41 days to the first trip on Rainy and 48 days to the next trip towards red lake. I have a very understanding wife. Oh yeh, 2 weeks after that I should be on rainy again for another 4 days.

>>Open camp May 1? Must be a lot of ice still isn't there? > >Usually goes out the end of May... so, I'm looking at getting >there the 1st or 2nd. Usually goes out the end of APRIL lol... so I'm going to get there the first or second of May.
No problem my friend. We leave nothing but footprints
143 until we hit Lac Seul. I have a freezer full of great fish, but nothing beats the fish at shore lunch, heck, even the beans taste better when served on a plate on the shore. Cheers... IA Walleye

540 something!!! We don't get to go to Canada this summer. Have to do the Family thing which is cool. Taking the kids to ALASKA. Momma says she wants to take the kids on one big trip while they they are still all near home and in high schol and college. She usually gets her way. In the meantime I come here all the time to keep my spirit up, and maybe learn about a kick #### new spot. Looking for a Smallie-Walleye-Pike Lake -fly in- boat in or drive in. Maybe Lac Seul or Kenora area. Like remote though, I am around people everyday and I love the part of being only people on lake. Good luck to u all and report back on your trips, keeps the fire burning. Oh how a cold LaBatts and hot piece of Fresh walleye tastes. Hate to miss it. But will be a Hoot taking our 4 girls 14-21 to Alaska so they can see it for themselves and not in Pictures. Will truly be priceless.
gullrock in 129. ditto the others on the fresh walleye, adult beverage of choice and great memories.
176 days to Lac Seul Evergreen Lodge. First time there but have been to Lac Seul several times. I've been itchy since we left last year.

156 days but who's counting. Taking my dad to Wiley Point on LOTW. First time we get to go to Canada together in 10 years, and it will be his 65th birthday present....and fathers day....and Christmas...lol

146 days, 8 hours, 9 minutes, 8 seconds (approximately) ´til I´m on my way to Gullrock. I have a countdown timer on my computer desktop. Been a long winter. Can´t wait to taste those golden fillets and set the hook on a big one. "I still got it, I just can´t remember where I put it." Dirt
134 days for me. I have to ditto Obabikon and say it is hard to beat a shore lunch on a lake in Canada. Pete
Opening week on Gullrock.....think that's 123 days. Opening is a bit earlier this year. Just thinking today we may have to pack some long johns.

133 days, and I will be jigging up some awesome Minnitaki eyes. The Molson/steaks/cigars/fried breakfast potatoes are going to be good!!! I am not even going to whine about prices because I am going regardless. Anyone else??
You bet I'm going to be there! 146 days and counting.

132 days,manitou falls camp,ear falls, english river, 7 adjoining lakes on the system. only camp on the chain.wallies and smallies,north stars and muskeegins,some good whitefish as well.my son and a buddy for a week.can taste the blues now. man do i hate winter!!! bender ouuutt!!

If my numbers are right, 122 days till May 24 and a week of Red lake, taking some walleye tackle, but mostly all musky/northern stuff and going to find the biggest northern we can..:) This will be a bit different for us, as we usually go late fall and fish for mostly walleyes, ought to be interesting. Definitely had enough of winter Al
142 for us. That Labatt's I had at the AC show really got my blood pumping. Nothing like a cold one (and a real one) while enjoying freshly caught walleye. Can't wait.
120 days till Minaki. Blues,Venison burgers,Grilled lobster tails and more Blues. Oh yeah the fishing is not too bad either.
Exactly 100 days until it's time to get the camp ready! Man, I honestly can't wait until my first shore lunch! Fish just isn't the same, unless you caught it that morning.
Open camp May 1? Must be a lot of ice still isn't there?

Well I hope you all have a great time up here, bring home alot of memories and a few fish for the family! Sometimes I think we as Canadians take what we have in our own backyard for granted.. Nice to see some folks excited to come here and play! Please can I ask one favour though? I ask this to US and Canadian fishermen alike.. Take home more then you came with... and by that statement I mean bring a garbage bag with you, if you see junk please put it in the bag. It is up to each of us to keep our natural resources as natural as possible. I have been in the bush many times and still I cant escape the dreaded Tim Hortons cup or beer can. and you know what? It is safe to say 95% of that junk is from Canadians! Please if you see litter pick it up.. Have a great trip, Have a great time, be safe and please post a report upon your return! AC.
>Open camp May 1? Must be a lot of ice still isn't there? Usually goes out the end of May... so, I'm looking at getting there the 1st or 2nd.
